intro: Alopecurus carolinianus, commonly known as Carolinian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as along roadsides or in wet meadows. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are spike-like, consisting of tiny green to brown florets, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Alopecurus carolinianus is often found in wetland habitats and is considered a characteristic species of certain wetland communities.
